description: Canine Heartworm Disease (CHD) caused by Dirofilaria immitis is a commonly diagnosed parasitic disease. Dirofilaria immitis is a parasitic roundworm that is a type of filarial worm, a small thread-like worm, that causes dirofilariasis. It is spread from host to host through the bites of mosquitoes. The definitive host is the dog, but it can also infect cats, wolves, foxes, and other animals, and under rare circumstances, humans.
name: Canine Heartworm Antibodies and Antigens
